content: Awesome solo experience

Great game. I've been stuck on the last level of the Great Wizard for a while... RNG hates me. Love the questing motivation for us solo folk. I really enjoy regular Talisman and would love to see more DLC for that along these lines. Just more solo content all around and quest stuff in general.
Still progress isnt synced or saved when uninstalling and you must start from the beginning same as in Talisman when you going to fix this? Everything else is perfect with redmi note pro
Excellent digital version!
The game is too buggy can't even play, it doesn't respond clicks

Won't connect to Google Play, won't start. I see someone else posted this back in November. This is super basic, this shouldn't happen consistently to an app. Fix and I'll change my review. I'm on Android 10, Galaxy S9.

Really enjoy the solo experience! I'm a big fan of Talisman. The game has all the elements I enjoy: cards, board, fantasy setting, good mix of strategy & chance, lots of variability, replayability, dice rolling...... Now this solo mode is really done well! I like the "quest" idea and it gives the game a focus. I still play the original Talisman game when I want to just play a general game online or against the AI, but Origins gives this game a new way to play. Great book feel to the main menu!
Worst 2 bucks ive ever spent. The story missions are so unbelievably pointless, boring and long because they disable major factors of the game to tell a nonsense underwhelming story.

It won't connect to Google play services and I can't play the game. Please help. My other games connect no problem. I haven't been able to even open either versions of talisman. I have Google Pixel 3.
replyContent: Hi Ryan. Sorry to hear you are having this problem. I see you have contacted support, so thanks for that. We'll try and fix this as soon as we can. Sorry for the inconvenience.

content: After the last update, the fonts are large and the cards dont show as .. cards. I cant plqy it. Please fix this as it was before update.

Suffers the same kinds of issues the Talisman digital version did. This thing is so buggy. Have tried 3 tubes to finish the Dark Wizard quest but no matter what, never allows me to enter plain of peril. Desperately in need of many bug fixes. No it had nothing to do with any of the legitimate reasons you can't enter. Had to uninstall and reinstall the whole thing. Lost all the progress and had to start over. (This is what support instructed me to do...)
replyContent: Hi. There are many reasons why you might not be able to pass through the Portal of Power, all within the rules. If you are on a quest for the Warlock, you cannot pass, also if there is a Dragon Token on that space. If you do find bugs then please contact us and we will get them fixed in an update - support@nomadgames.co.uk

content: Good game. Can't use paste to write password

Relies on skewed dice rolling mechanics rather than quality AI. If you have otherwise even odds with opponent, they will out roll you 75%. Use back button and quit to reseed the dice and watch the busted odds at play.
Flames of war bug fixed so works well now.
replyContent: Sorry to hear this. This issue is now fixed so please update to the latest version.

content: Would have given five stars, but the Flames of War crashes at the beginning of the book and since you have to beat it to unlock the next book. that means two whole books are completely unplayable. Have reported to Asmodee but got no response. Edit: Bug seems to have been fixed in latest update. Thanks!
Great solo talisman

I have an issue with chapter 4 on Great wizard. i did almost all quests from main objective which is kill Ifrits on board but cant find last Ifrit Sorcerest anywhere on board and cant progress to next chapter.
replyContent: Hi. Sorry to hear that. It's possible, but unlikely, that the Ifrit Sorceress has been removed from the board by a certain effect if you cannot see the card anywhere. If that is the case, your only option is to start that particular quest again. To do this, press the circular arrow button on the chapter select screen.

content: Great game .
I was forced to pay for this again and all it is is a renaming of Talisman prologue
This game is really fun.

As a long-time Talisman (analog and digital) fan, i would rate this as a 5 if it weren't for (A) the sheer number of bugs (i've filed 4 or 5 so far, at least one of which required restarting a mission to work around it) and (B) the hard-coded 5-second delay (at UI level 10) between the start of an NPCs turn and when it rolls its dice (that's absolutely maddening, especially when 3 NPCs are in play).
replyContent: Hi Stephan. Thanks for alerting to the bugs, we will take a look. You can increase the AI's speed in the Settings menu, under UI speed. Set that to 10 and it should help.

content: More negative than positive
Same great game, now solo
Same issue, dice are black blobs...contacted support but no resolution
replyContent: Please try the latest update which fixes this issue. Thanks for your patience.

content: very enjoyable offshoot of the original

Really quite disappointed. It's a single player game that requires a network connection yet still has no local or cloud save apparently. I have lost all my progress upon reinstall (logging into google and asmodee accounts made no change.) The game itself is so much like the standard Talisman that I really dont understand why it wasnt released as an expansion. It would be wonderful if you could update the UI so us old coots that played the original tabletop can actually read the text. 🤔
replyContent: Please try again now! The data has been corrected. Sorry for the confusion.

content: I've played cardboard and electronic versions of Talisman for years, and this twist doesn't disappoint. A single player version with plot-like goals and objective fits the game-verse well and plays out addictively. Dev support is great. I really hope they add scenarios and characters as they did for the original game. Great job.
replyContent: Please try the latest update which should fix this issue. Thanks for your patience.
